a.  The mean connectivity value is a measure of the relative connectivity of habitats on a scale of 0 (not connected) to 100 (contiguous habitat).  Typical values are between zero and one.
b.  Changes shown by an asterisk (*) indicate a significance change between 1990 and 2007.
Habitat connectivity in the wider countryside, 1990 to 2007

column1: 1.  The mean connectivity value is a measure of the relative connectivity of habitats on a scale of 0 (not connected) to 100 (contiguous habitat).  Typical values are between zero and one.
2.  Changes shown by an asterisk (*) indicate a significance change between 1990 and 2007.
